intro: Diapedium pectinatum f. lacteum, commonly known as the milky diapedium, is a variant of the diapedium pectinatum species, which belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae. This plant is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinctive feature of the genus Diapedium. The leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small and clustered in complex inflorescences, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
